description.text: Set checkpoint interval (>= 1) or disable checkpoint (-1). Ex) 10 means that the cache will get checkpointed every 10 iterations
Criterion used for information gain calculation (case-insensitive). Supported: "entropy" and "gini"

Maximum number of bins used for discretizing continuous features and for choosing how to split on features at each node. More bins give higher granularity. Must be >= 2 and >= number of categories in any categorical feature
Maximum depth of the tree (>= 0). Ex) depth 0 means 1 leaf node; depth 1 means 1 internal node + 2 leaf nodes
Minimum information gain for a split to be considered at a tree node
Minimum number of instances each child must have after split. If a split causes the left or right child to have fewer than minInstancesPerNode, the split will be discarded as invalid (>= 1)

Change the type of columns in the active dataset

message.default: The checkpoint interval value must either be >= 1 or -1 to disable
Maximum number of bins must be >= 2 or Maximum depth cannot be empty
info gain should not equal min instance
